Regarding the SubVersion messages discussion, I wrote a fairly simple app that makes a nice looking report based on commit messages. It probably doesn't have all the features you need, but I thought I'd plug it anyway :-). It'll work as long as there is a public endpoint for the repo (does support username/password).

http://krazyyak.com/svnreport/

I talked about it here: http://blog.krazyyak.com/2008/09/28/svn-report-generator/

Can you really sell an account considering you use OpenID?  You could only sell your account if you can change your Open ID provider unless you don't care about your Open ID.

For the sitemaps, the upper limit on size is 50,000 URLs or 10MB. You can stitch multiple sitemaps together with a sitemap index. That's limited to 1,000 sitemap references.

So, you will only have a problem when you hit 50,000,000 pages (or 10GB or URLs) which you need indexed. :)
I agree with Joel. Need better ways to find unanswered questions you may know the answer too.

Hi,

I made a Greasemonkey script that improves what I think are the two core problems with Stack Overflow's design - it makes the site wider and use a dynamic width and normalises fonts to they're all set to "small". It's a little slow, and due to the mixture of tables, attributes, external CSS and inline CSS on the site it's pretty ugly but it does seem to work pretty well.

Link: http://userscripts.org/scripts/show/33804

Screenshot: http://img523.imageshack.us/my.php?image=stackunderflowjw9.png
The FAQ says its better to gzip the sitemaps file and I see the SOflow file doesn't. You may not have to waste 4MB of transfer every time.

Strange, it sure looks compressed to me, and all the third party tools I've used to test it confirm that it is.
